dt: {bc}a characterizing word or phrase accompanying or occurring in place of the name of a person or thing
{bc}a disparaging or abusive word or phrase
{bc}the part of a taxonomic name identifying a subordinate unit within a genus

et: Latin {it}epitheton{/it}, from Greek, from neuter of {it}epithetos{/it} added, from {it}epitithenai{/it} to put on, add, from {it}epi-{/it} + {it}tithenai{/it} to put {ma}{mat|do|}{/ma}
shortdef: a characterizing word or phrase accompanying or occurring in place of the name of a person or thing
a disparaging or abusive word or phrase
the part of a taxonomic name identifying a subordinate unit within a genus

dt: {bc}the Latin or latinized noun or adjective that follows the genus name in a taxonomic binomial

shortdef: the Latin or latinized noun or adjective that follows the genus name in a taxonomic binomial
